ygData.messageBody:
Amen Scott. You understand how it works, and you give very valid scenario's
where it is applicable.

Now, for the other person who said that a persons plan to have a steady
price for banded wouldn't "work for shit", my good sir you are QUITE wrong.
If all the blacksmiths (probably never ever happen, but still) got together,
and deemed a flat rate at which to sell their products, above what they
currently are, and refuse to lower their prices save perhaps 1pp here or
there, people will be forced to do 1 of 3 things.

1.) Wait until someone, who already has banded, buys something better and
sells their banded for cheap, or...
2.) Plop 150pp + and many hours of game time into learning smithing, or....
3.) Buy for the prices us, the smith's, charge.

It's the people of Everquest, us, all of us that play, that determine's the
flow of the market. I tell you that I for one am sick of loosing so much
money on blacksmithing because people always tell me that "so and so sells
for cheaper". Good for them. I'm not "so and so". I've spent over 150pp
working on the skill, and have made MAYBE 40pp of that back. And that's
with an extra 100pp or so in materials.

Now sure, you can sell cheaper than anyone else. But you gotta remember
this. How much banded will you be able to sell in an hour? And, with your
cheap prices, how much will you make? Not much, I'm betting. Although
those of us who decide to stick with a price might not sell quite as often
as you, we will make more money, with less time spent, than you ever will.

Anyhow, my 2 cent's (again).

Dennis Meek
aka Haijar the Mage Blacksmith
